With the locked Pawn position on the Q-side, the game is destined to go slowly.
The first real action takes place, with an exchange of minor pieces.
moves.16. Rc1 Nd7 17. Bb1 Nc5 18. Ne1: An error, leaving the KP en prise.
moves.19... Nxe4 20. Nb2 Bxb5 21. cxb5: Well, at least I have an open file for my Rook.
moves.21... Bg5 22. Bxe4: Whoops, another oversight.  At this level that's how games are decided.
moves.22... Bxc1 23. Qxc1: Huh, not so bad after all. Material is even but unbalanced.
moves.23... Rc8 24. Qd2 Rc3 25. Bc2 Qc7 26. Nc: Breaking the linkage of the Black pieces on the QB file.
moves.29... Rf3 30. Qxd6: This time Black overlooked that a pawn was en prise.
moves.30... Qb8 31. Qxb6: I win another Pawn and offer another exchange of Q's.
moves.35. Nc4 Rd8 36. Qe6 Qg5 37. Ne3: A blunder, although loss of some material appears inevitable.
moves.39. Kg2 Qxc1 40. Qe7: The way the material edge has been shifting back and forth, it's far from over.
moves.41. Kh3 Rg8: Locking the position against any back rank mates.
moves.42. d6: H'mm, I have a couple of passed Pawns...
moves.43... Qd8 44. Qd6: Black can stop the one Pawn, but another danger lurks...
moves.45... Rg7 46. b7: I now threaten P-N8 (Q) pinning and winning the Queen.
moves.48... Qxb8 49. Qxb8+: It's still far from over. A Rook and two Pawns including a protected passer has chances against a Queen.
moves.49... Kf7 50. Qe5: I hasten back to the danger zone.
moves.50... Kg8 51. Qxa5: Time to start eliminating Black Pawns.
moves.53... g5 54. Kg2 g4: A mistake. 54... P-B5 would leave Black with two connected passed Pawns if I chose to exchange them.
moves.55. Qe2 Kf7 56. h3 h5 57. hxg4 hxg4: Now I have one Pawn holding 2 on the K side.
moves.58. b4 Kg6 59. Kf1 Kg5 60. a5: My Q-side Pawns are now a distinct threat.
moves.60... f4 61. gxf4+ Kxf4 62. Kg2: With Black's K-side Pawns now split I should be able to pick them off.
moves.64... Rd2+ 65. Kf1 e2+ 66. Ke1: The plan is now QxP at the correct moment, and after ...RxQ KxR I can win with my connected QR and QN Pawns.
moves.66... Ra2 67. Qh5+ Kd4 68. Qxe2 Ra1+: Black doesn't want to give up his last piece...
moves.69... Rxd1+ 70. Kxd1: Now it's a simple matter of technique.
